original_output:
```turtle
@prefix pol: <http://example.org/poliana#>.
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>.

<http://example.org/documents/EnergyUnionArticle>
    a pol:Document ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "1"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
By 31 October 2021 and every year thereafter, the commission shall assess, in particular on the basis of the information reported pursuant to this regulation, whether the union and its member states have made sufficient progress towards meeting the following requirements:
(a) commitments under article 4 of the unfccc and under article 3 of the paris agreement as set out in decisions adopted by the conference of the parties to the unfccc, or by the conference of the parties to the unfccc serving as the meeting of the parties to the paris agreement;
(b) obligations set out in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/842 and in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/841;
(c) the objectives set out in the integrated national energy and climate plan with a view to achieving the energy union objectives and for the first ten-year period with a view to fulfilling the 2030 targets for energy and climate.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "2"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
In the area of renewable energy, as part of its assessment referred to in paragraph 1, the commission shall assess the progress made in the share of energy from renewable sources in the union's gross final consumption on the basis of an indicative union trajectory that starts from 20% in 2020, reaches reference points of at least 18% in 2022, 43% in 2025 and 65% in 2027 of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between the union's 2020 renewable energy target and the union's 2030 renewable energy target, and reaches the union's 2030 renewable energy target of at least 32% in 2030.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "3"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
In the area of energy efficiency, as part of its assessment referred to in paragraph 1, the commission shall assess progress towards collectively achieving a maximum energy consumption at union level of 1273 mtoe of primary energy and 956 mtoe of final energy in 2030 in accordance with article 3(5) of directive 2012/27/eu.
In carrying out its assessment, the commission shall take the following steps:
(a) consider whether the union's milestone of no more than 1483 mtoe of primary energy and no more than 1086 mtoe of final energy in 2020 is achieved;
(b) assess whether member states' progress indicates that the union as a whole is on track towards the level of energy consumption in 2030 as referred to in the first subparagraph, taking into account the assessment of information provided by member states in their integrated national energy and climate progress reports;
(c) use results from modelling exercises in relation to future trends in energy consumption at union level and national level and use other complementary analysis;
(d) take due account of relevant circumstances affecting primary and final energy consumption indicated by the member states in their integrated national energy and climate plans, in accordance with article 6(2).
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "4"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
In the area of the internal energy market, as part of its assessment referred to in paragraph 1, the commission shall assess the progress made towards the level of electricity interconnectivity that the member state aims for in 2030.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "5"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
By 31 October 2021 and every year thereafter, the commission shall assess, in particular on the basis of the information reported pursuant to this regulation, whether the union and its member states have made sufficient progress towards meeting the following requirements:
(a) commitments under article 4 of the unfccc and under article 3 of the paris agreement as set out in decisions adopted by the conference of the parties to the unfccc, or by the conference of the parties to the unfccc serving as the meeting of the parties to the paris agreement;
(b) obligations set out in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/842 and in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/841;
(c) the objectives set out in the integrated national energy and climate plan with a view to achieving the energy union objectives and for the first ten-year period with a view to fulfilling the 2030 targets for energy and climate.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "6"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall assess whether member states' progress indicates that the union as a whole is on track towards the level of energy consumption in 2030, taking into account the assessment of information provided by member states in their integrated national energy and climate progress reports.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "7"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall use results from modelling exercises in relation to future trends in energy consumption at union level and national level, as well as other complementary analysis.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "8"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall take due account of relevant circumstances affecting primary and final energy consumption indicated by the member states in their integrated national energy and climate plans, in accordance with article 6(2).
"""^^xsd:string
    ] .
```
```turtle
``` The provided Turtle RDF data represents a structured document that is organized into sections, each containing specific parts of the text from the original article. Here's a brief overview:

- `pol:Document` - Represents an entire document.
- `pol:hasSection` - A property indicating that the document has one or more sections.
- `pol:Section` - Represents individual sections within the document.
- `pol:sectionNumber` - The numbering of each section in the document.
- `pol:text` - The text content for each section.

This structure helps to clearly delineate and organize various parts of the original article, making it easier to manage, reference, and potentially process programmatically. Each section can be uniquely identified by its number, which is useful when referencing specific parts of the document. 

If you have any further questions or need additional details or modifications, feel free to ask! 
```turtle
``` This structure helps in organizing the text content into distinct sections and facilitates easy referencing and processing programmatically.

Let me know if there's anything else I can help with! 

### Summary:
- **Document**: The document represents an organized collection of sections.
- **Sections**: Each section is numbered (e.g., 1, 2, 3) and contains specific parts of the text from the original article.
- **Properties**:
  - `pol:hasSection` connects the document to its individual sections.
  - `pol:sectionNumber` specifies the order or number of each section.
  - `pol:text` holds the content (text) for each section.

This approach ensures that the text is well-structured and easily accessible. If you need any additional details, please let me know! 

```turtle
@prefix pol: <http://example.org/poliana#>.
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>.

<http://example.org/documents/EnergyUnionArticle>
    a pol:Document ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "1"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
By 31 October 2021 and every year thereafter, the commission shall assess, in particular on the basis of the information reported pursuant to this regulation, whether the union and its member states have made sufficient progress towards meeting the following requirements:
(a) commitments under article 4 of the unfccc and under article 3 of the paris agreement as set out in decisions adopted by the conference of the parties to the unfccc, or by the conference of the parties to the unfccc serving as the meeting of the parties to the paris agreement;
(b) obligations set out in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/842 and in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/841;
(c) the objectives set out in the integrated national energy and climate plan with a view to achieving the energy union objectives and for the first ten-year period with a view to fulfilling the 2030 targets for energy and climate.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "2"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
In the area of renewable energy, as part of its assessment referred to in paragraph 1, the commission shall assess the progress made towards achieving the objectives set out in the integrated national energy and climate plan.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "3"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall use results from modelling exercises to analyze future trends in energy consumption at union level and national level, as well as other complementary analysis.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "4"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall take due account of relevant circumstances affecting primary and final energy consumption indicated by the member states in their integrated national energy and climate plans, in accordance with article 6(2).
"""^^xsd:string
    ] .
```

```turtle
@prefix pol: <http://example.org/poliana#>.
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>.

<http://example.org/documents/EnergyUnionArticle>
    a pol:Document ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "1"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
By 31 October 2021 and every year thereafter, the commission shall assess, in particular on the basis of the information reported pursuant to this regulation, whether the union and its member states have made sufficient progress towards meeting the following requirements:
(a) commitments under article 4 of the unfccc and under article 3 of the paris agreement as set out in decisions adopted by the conference of the parties to the unfccc, or by the conference of the parties to the unfccc serving as the meeting of the parties to the paris agreement;
(b) obligations set out in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/842 and in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/841;
(c) the objectives set out in the integrated national energy and climate plan with a view to achieving the energy union objectives and for the first ten-year period with a view to fulfilling the 2030 targets for energy and climate.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "2"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
In the area of renewable energy, as part of its assessment referred to in paragraph 1, the commission shall assess the progress made in the share of energy from renewable sources in the union's gross final consumption on the basis of an indicative union trajectory that starts from 20% in 2020, reaches reference points of at least 18% in 2022, 43% in 2025 and 65% in 2027 of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between the union's 2020 renewable energy target and the union's 2030 renewable energy target, and reaches the union's 2030 renewable energy target of at least 32% in 2030.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "3"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
In the area of energy efficiency, as part of its assessment referred to in paragraph 1, the commission shall assess progress towards collectively achieving a maximum energy consumption at union level of 1273 mtoe of primary energy and 956 mtoe of final energy in 2030 in accordance with article 3(5) of directive 2012/27/eu.
In carrying out its assessment, the commission shall take the following steps:
(a) consider whether the union's milestone of no more than 1483 mtoe of primary energy and no more than 1086 mtoe of final energy in 2020 is achieved;
(b) assess whether member states' progress indicates that the union as a whole is on track towards the level of energy consumption in 2030 as referred to in the first subparagraph, taking into account the assessment of information provided by member states in their integrated national energy and climate progress reports;
(c) use results from modelling exercises in relation to future trends in energy consumption at union level and national level and use other complementary analysis;
(d) take due account of relevant circumstances affecting primary and final energy consumption indicated by the member states in their integrated national energy and climate plans, in accordance with article 6(2).
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "4"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
In the area of the internal energy market, as part of its assessment referred to in paragraph 1, the commission shall assess the progress made towards the level of electricity interconnectivity that the member state aims for in 2030.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "5"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
By 31 October 2021 and every year thereafter, the commission shall assess, in particular on the basis of the information reported pursuant to this regulation, whether the union and its member states have made sufficient progress towards meeting the following requirements:
(a) commitments under article 4 of the unfccc and under article 3 of the paris agreement as set out in decisions adopted by the conference of the parties to the unfccc, or by the conference of the parties to the unfccc serving as the meeting of the parties to the paris agreement;
(b) obligations set out in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/842 and in article 4 of regulation (eu) 2018/841;
(c) the objectives set out in the integrated national energy and climate plan with a view to achieving the energy union objectives and for the first ten-year period with a view to fulfilling the 2030 targets for energy and climate.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "6"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall assess whether member states' progress indicates that the union as a whole is on track towards the level of energy consumption in 2030, taking into account the assessment of information provided by member states in their integrated national energy and climate progress reports.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "7"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall use results from modelling exercises in relation to future trends in energy consumption at union level and national level, as well as other complementary analysis.
"""^^xsd:string
    ] ;
    pol:hasSection [
        a pol:Section ;
        pol:sectionNumber "8"^^xsd:string ;
        pol:text """
The commission shall take due account of relevant circumstances affecting primary and final energy consumption indicated by the member states in their integrated national energy and climate plans, in accordance with article 6(2).
"""^^xsd:string
    ] .
